sentence:
Any differences with a p-value < 0.05 were considered significant.Results
Data mining
The results of the TCGA database via GEPIA2 revealed that mRNA expression of the Talin-1 gene was higher (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5) in 461 skin cutaneous melanoma tissues compared to the 558 normal skin tissues (P < 0.01, Fig. 1).

Furthermore, obtained data based on GENT2 from the displayed GEO mRNA expression level of Talin-1 was significantly higher in skin cancer tissues compared to the normal skin tissues (GPL570 platform) (Supplementary Tables 1 and Supplementary Fig. 1).
The comparison between gene expression of data from normal tissues, primary tumors, and metastatic tissues was shown in the heat map and boxplot in Fig. 2.
High expression of Talin-1 was found in mRNA levels in tumors compared with normal tissues (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5 and P < 0.01) by Gene Expression Profiling Interactive Analysis (GEPIA2).Fig. 2.
All cores showed different levels of staining in the cytoplasm (Fig. 3).
Moreover, normal human kidney tissue used as a positive control showed strong staining in renal epithelial cells (Fig. 3).

Our findings showed that no significant associations between DSS or PFS and the patients with high and low expression of the Talin-1 protein in melanoma (Log-rank test: DSS P = 0.503, PFS P = 0.800) and NMSC cases (Log-rank test: DSS P = 0.263, PFS P = 0.385). (Fig. 4).

Any differences with a p-value < 0.05 were considered significant.Results

Data mining
The results of the TCGA database via GEPIA2 revealed that mRNA expression of the Talin-1 gene was higher (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5) in 461 skin cutaneous melanoma tissues compared to the 558 normal skin tissues (P < 0.01, Fig. 1).

Furthermore, obtained data based on GENT2 from the displayed GEO mRNA expression level of Talin-1 was significantly higher in skin cancer tissues compared to the normal skin tissues (GPL570 platform) (Supplementary Tables 1 and Supplementary Fig. 1).
The comparison between gene expression of data from normal tissues, primary tumors, and metastatic tissues was shown in the heat map and boxplot in Fig. 2.

Results
Data mining
The results of the TCGA database via GEPIA2 revealed that mRNA expression of the Talin-1 gene was higher (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5) in 461 skin cutaneous melanoma tissues compared to the 558 normal skin tissues (P < 0.01, Fig. 1).

Furthermore, obtained data based on GENT2 from the displayed GEO mRNA expression level of Talin-1 was significantly higher in skin cancer tissues compared to the normal skin tissues (GPL570 platform) (Supplementary Tables 1 and Supplementary Fig. 1).
The comparison between gene expression of data from normal tissues, primary tumors, and metastatic tissues was shown in the heat map and boxplot in Fig. 2.
High expression of Talin-1 was found in mRNA levels in tumors compared with normal tissues (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5 and P < 0.01) by Gene Expression Profiling Interactive Analysis (GEPIA2).Fig. 2.
All cores showed different levels of staining in the cytoplasm (Fig. 3).
Moreover, normal human kidney tissue used as a positive control showed strong staining in renal epithelial cells (Fig. 3).

Our findings showed that no significant associations between DSS or PFS and the patients with high and low expression of the Talin-1 protein in melanoma (Log-rank test: DSS P = 0.503, PFS P = 0.800) and NMSC cases (Log-rank test: DSS P = 0.263, PFS P = 0.385). (Fig. 4).

Data mining
The results of the TCGA database via GEPIA2 revealed that mRNA expression of the Talin-1 gene was higher (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5) in 461 skin cutaneous melanoma tissues compared to the 558 normal skin tissues (P < 0.01, Fig. 1).

Furthermore, obtained data based on GENT2 from the displayed GEO mRNA expression level of Talin-1 was significantly higher in skin cancer tissues compared to the normal skin tissues (GPL570 platform) (Supplementary Tables 1 and Supplementary Fig. 1).
The comparison between gene expression of data from normal tissues, primary tumors, and metastatic tissues was shown in the heat map and boxplot in Fig. 2.
High expression of Talin-1 was found in mRNA levels in tumors compared with normal tissues (|Log2FC| Cut-off ≥ 0.5 and P < 0.01) by Gene Expression Profiling Interactive Analysis (GEPIA2).Fig. 2.

Furthermore, obtained data based on GENT2 from the displayed GEO mRNA expression level of Talin-1 was significantly higher in skin cancer tissues compared to the normal skin tissues (GPL570 platform) (Supplementary Tables 1 and Supplementary Fig. 1).
The comparison between gene expression of data from normal tissues, primary tumors, and metastatic tissues was shown in the heat map and boxplot in Fig. 2.
All cores showed different levels of staining in the cytoplasm (Fig. 3).
Moreover, normal human kidney tissue used as a positive control showed strong staining in renal epithelial cells (Fig. 3).

Our findings showed that no significant associations between DSS or PFS and the patients with high and low expression of the Talin-1 protein in melanoma (Log-rank test: DSS P = 0.503, PFS P = 0.800) and NMSC cases (Log-rank test: DSS P = 0.263, PFS P = 0.385). (Fig. 4).
